review: The service was the suckiest part. Good burger but our server was no where to be found most the time. The little checkout thing didn't work the one on the tables so we were disappointed to be seated at the only one that was off. The food,cleanliness, and vibe is the only reason for the stars.

I love Red Robin but I don't like it here. They're so stingy with the "bottomless" fries and the hostess was such a jerk.  We came in at a busy-ish time, so, I let the hostility slide. After ordering, the waitress did a really bad job at tending to us and making sure everything was okay. However, I assumed the time of the day played into effect about how we were being treated. The burgers were good and like any other Red Robin as expected from a chain restaurant so nothing really strikes out on this which gives the two stars in my rating.  I've visited other Red Robins, like the one in North Lake and there was such a drastic difference in atmosphere and service when compared to Fayetteville's. It's such a shame because I love this restaurant. Unfortunately, this is just going to be a restaurant I avoid, especially if it's a bad day for me.

This is my first visit to a Red Robin. I have to say that this review is more influenced by our server. She started by walking up, offering us the bottomless root beer floats only to promptly tell us we couldn't have them when one of our party ordered one. She was very slow to refill the bottomless drinks and fries and instead stood at a table behind us to flirt with two guys (which is where she spent most of her time).  We asked if we could switch our drink refills to a different bottomless drink and she informed us that we would be charged more if we did. We are not sure of the validity of her information, but we all believed her to be incorrect. Why would they charge us more for a different bottomless drink that was the same price or less expensive?  We ordered some pretzel bites, which came with half of a small container of dipping cheese for a large amount of pretzels. I had to ask three times for extra cheese before she bothered to come back with it and seemed overall disinterested in serving us.  The food came out relatively quick considering our larger party, but the garlic fries and burger buns were soggy with grease. Aside from the soggy bread, the burger was above average but nothing to write home about. The sweet potato fries were pretty good though.  Once we paid, the waitress never came back and ignored us. We were still eating and awaiting refills. We waited over 20 minutes before we eventually went up and asked for them.  Overall,  I think I'll pass on visiting Red Robin in the future.
Amazing burgers! One time I messed up an order and they fixed it for me free of charge! They are the perfect place to eat before or after shopping at the mall!

I did not enjoy my experience the last time I was here. During that visit I learned NOT to order anything except a burger.  There was not a wait even though it was pretty crowded in the restautant. Before we actualy sat down the hostess walked away. We ended up not even sitting where she was placing us. We sat somewhere else. Another server saw us and asked if we preferred to sit in a booth and she reseated us (thank God for her).  The server is great and has had a positive attitude. I feel comfortable that she is going to make sure the experience goes well.  So far we've ordered burgers. I was the only one at the table who made special requests (as usual). I asked to swap the Iceberg lettuce my burger came with for Romaine lettuce. I was told there is a $0.50 charge to sub the lettuce! I always sub the lettuce at EVERY restaurant I go to and this is the first time I've been charged to substitute nasty stinky Iceberg lettuce. My bacon cheeseburger was alright. Nothing to write home about. I don't know why I keep trying Red Robin. . . I think this was the last time. Service was GREAT, but my good. . . not so much.

We went to Red Robin for my son's birthday. After being lead to a booth, we waited for 25 minute with no one to ask for drinks or anything. It wasn't crowded as it was on a Monday about 6:45pm. Well the four of us got up and began walking out with still no one stopping to ask if we been served. We've been here a few times and this was terrible, and I told the girl up front that it was my son's birthday. Thanks for a great birthday dinner! NOT!!! Never eating here ever again. We ended up going to Bubba's 33 and had a great time, great service, awesome  food, the manager even ask how was our food was and even a birthday surprise for my son.

What is up RR ???  I knew it would be busy because of a payday Friday but cmon !!! After being seated by a very nice server it took 15 minutes to get our drinks and another 30 minutes for food.  Now mind you I have been to RR many times , most recently last month in another state but this was my first in Fayetteville.  I always order the same burger, Royal Red Robin, always so big I can barely finish it.  To my surprise what I got at this RR was a beef patty the same size as single regular Mickey D burger, I was shocked, and to make matters worse approximately 8-10 fries, cmon.  I wanted to question the server about the size of the burger but I kind of knew what the answer would be.  Don't get me wrong it was a tasty meal, got more fries and refills on drinks but I still feel I was shortchanged.  I hope someone from RR would read this and respond.  6/19/2017 We returned to RR for my annual Birthday Burger.  The last time we were here it was not good.  I contacted RR customer service after our last visit.  RR contacted me about our concerns and was sent a credit.  Much better this time and was pleasantly pleased with differences between visits.

REEEEEED ROBIN, YUUUUUUMMMMMMMM!!!!! Always wanted to try this place and I was not disappointed. Got the salted caramel milkshake and it was sooooooooooooo good. Also ordered the Red Robin burger with fried egg and bacon and man that burger was delish!!!! Everything was good, very very happy with it.

Love Red Robin, however the service here is terrible!! We had a server by the name of Nicole and she was not attentive whatsoever.  We waited over 40 minutes to get our food.  She had offered to bring fries in between our wait, but that never happened.  In those 40 minutes she only checked on us once.  Super unhappy with the service we received here.  I was tempted to not leave her a tip but I did.  Management seriously needs to look into hiring servers that will be attentive.  A busy night or not, servers should be checking on the customers.  By the way it was not a super busy night.

These burgers are the best! Add in fries and campfire sauce and you have one delicious meal! Service and ambiance is very important to us so we sit at the bar and get the best attention (and no kids screaming nearby). Darcie makes drinks exactly how I like them and always makes sure we have everything we need. We can always count on this for a great weekly meal!

This is the worst Red Robin I have ever had the misfortune to go to. Upon entering the restaurant, we waited 5 minutes to get seated but that was understandable. Once we got seated, we continued to wait an additional 20 minutes before anyone even took the time to come to the table to get our drink order. By then, we were ready to go. When the same waitress walked past the table 3 times and took another order that came in after us. I will never come back to this place again. At least Western Sizzlin has amazon burgers as well with half the price and better employees.

Came here for a quick, late dinner after watching a late night movie. We were informed as soon as we were seated that the kitchen was closing in 15 minutes, half an hour prior to actual closing hour, which seems oddly early....Despite this, we were still treated very well! Yes, we were rushed to order, but once we put our orders in, we no longer felt rushed by the staff. I had a bowl of Chili (beans and peppers, topped with cheddar and red onions for $5.89), which turned out to be spicier than I expected. Not one of the best bowls of chili I've ever had, but not terrible either. I would have liked some sour cream on top to help cool off some of the spiciness. My boyfriend had a burger with fries on the side. Even though it was near closing, we still received free refills on the fries! We dipped the fries in chipotle ranch sauce, which tastes awesome! And our server made sure to refill our water without us asking. I didn't order anything fancy, but considering how late it was, we had a great experience and were treated respectfully. We only felt rushed in the beginning.
Onion rings and French onion soup are always amazing, helps that it was cold outside too. Sat at the bar and the lady was super friendly.
I love this restaurant. It is always clean. The staff is extremely kind as well. They have never messed up my order or anyone else's that I've gone with. Would recommend.

I would run out of space before i finished with everything wrong with this establishment. The fries are slow to come out and greasy, the burgers are RAW on the inside even when you specifically ask for them to be well done. The waitress attempted to explain that the burgers are made on a conveyor like a pizza and they run them through twice if someone doesnt want it pink. so much for freshly grilled with care and attention. DO NOT come here if you have a timed lunch, you will not get your food and eat before you are out of time.

I went to Red Robin on a Friday night. The place was packed.  Our server was Louis. He had about 8 tables it seemed, and he handled them all very well. He was attentive, but he still managed to get to everyone in a timely manner. He was courteous, and he came back just enough to let us know he hadn't forgotten us while not feeling like he was being intrusive. We recieved GREAT service. Thank you, Louis. The food on the other hand was not so great. Specifically, the macaroni and cheese. I got some kind of burger, and it was delicious. However I'm concerned about the quality of meat served because I wasn't allowed to have my burger served rare. That is usually an indication that the meat is not too quality. My BOTTOMLESS sweet potato fries were also spot on.  My husband got a different burger and macaroni and cheese. It was quite literally just cooked macaroni with melted cheese in top. No seasonings. No butter, milk, or anything else. If you come from anywhere below the Mason-Dixon line, you eill not be pleased with this side! Avoid it!

Waited 30 mins for a melted milkshake. Waited a full hour for cold fries and a burger I didn't order.  The general manager comped the whole meal for our party of 3 and talked us in to staying for free meal that she would prepare. Also offered us fries to snack in while we wait.....they were cold. By the time our food got there the temp was very ehhh at best. I will NOT be returning to this poorly managed restaurant.

So far this entire dining experience leaves me wishing we had just gotten burgers at a fast food place. The waiter took forever to come get our drink order. He seemed frazzled like maybe he was overwhelmed with the 5 tables he had.  We ordered drinks and our meals at the same time as our food as we had more than ample time to look at the menu.  Our drinks finally arrived and my margarita was probably the most poorly made margarita I've ever had. It tasted like I was drinking sweet and sour mix straight from the cup. There were no straws to stir it so I walked to the bar to get some. The bartender was rude and asked "oh you want straws. We don't have any". This restaurant charges for extremely overpriced burgers and can't afford stir straws?!?!???  I managed to choke down the margarita without breathing so I wouldn't taste it as the waiter did not care that I said it was disgusting with no offer to replace it. I ordered a bottled beer instead thinking they couldn't mess that up. I was wrong. Instead of my bottled hard root beer, he brought it serves over ice cream, which I did not order and which cost $4 MORE than just the beer. I said fine don't worry about it, as my beer sat on the bar for 5 mins before I even got it and didn't want to wait another 5 mins for a drink (I was in full view of the bar and timed it).  The burgers were decent as usual. Not worth $15, but tasted good. I was not able to finish the root beer float concoction because it was not only very heavy with a large burger, but because it tasted terrible.  The bartender and waiter were both unconcerned with our complaints and we paid the check in full. I didn't make a huge issue of it, I just wanted to leave.  I WILL NOT be returning to this particular Red Robin due to the terrible service and poor attitude of a very untrained bartender. If you aren't drinking this will be pretty close to any other Red Robin you are used to.

Service is beyond mediocre. I was really disappointed in our server, who couldn't manage to bring my friend the fries or the ranch she asked for until being prompted to do so on three separate occasions.  However, with that having been said, the food and drink are Red Robin, meaning they're really good. I tried their Blue Moon/Svedka cocktail in a can, and that was the best decision I've made in weeks. Their Gardenburger is yummy and made even better with the addition of avocado slices. I do also love the concept of endless steak fries as well, as theirs are hot, crunchy, and well-seasoned.  Give it a shot. We were seated with a number of young children, so it's possible service was off-kilter because of it. The food is worth it.

First time here in about 6 years. The food looks great on the commercials but is just ok in real life. The atmosphere is nice, restaurant clean, and the servers were very nice and did their job. I got their burger with the egg on it. The egg was the most flovorfuk part of the sandwich. It came out room tempurture with floppy bacon. The worst part about the burger was the bun. Tasteless, dry, crumbly...like bargain bin bread that they sell when it's at the expiration date. Just not good. I give it on 5 stars on everything but the food. It was just "ehhh". And I don't know that that's a chef issue as much as it is a corporate recipe issue. Those are the buns they chose for that burger. Maybe a pretzel bun or a brioche roll would've been better. Go for the company.

I love Red Robin as far as a chain goes I'm just not impressed with this location. Trying to give it a shot we have been here 4 times in the last 2 months.  Staff is friendly this is nothing against the servers I believe they are too understaffed to give you good service so it's not their fault.  The last 2 times I've been there has been on a weekend including holiday weekends Mothers Day & Memorial. They had 1 bar tender SERIOUSLY ??? The entire bar area has been full of dirty in bussed tables left purposely that way so people couldn't sit at them. That's a loss of $$$ so I really don't understand it. Plan better.  The last time we came will probably be just that... The last time. Our burgers were  delivered with incorrect cheese and so over cooked the only reason they weren't sent back was how long we had to wait for them. The server never returned to refill our "Bottomless Fries"  or our beverages. This location needs better management I'm sorry I really wanted to like it due to the location.
Ate lunch here today. Needed some burgers and endless fries. Restaurant  is redone and much cleaner than before.  Total cost for lunch and pie was 32.00. Food was good and service was fast.
Ordered my burger and the fries were stale. I had to send them back. Waiting for food remakes is never a good start to a first visit.

I'm usually always warm and have my air up high. This restaurant is freezing! Like 50 degrees freezing. We had to leave. Won't be going back for overpriced burgers and shakes. Hell, just ordering a lemonade was nearly $5

I haven't been to a Red Robin in years, and this last visit was a reminder why. The burger patty seriously had to have been a welfare patty with some sauce on it. It started pouring out and we when we grabbed our drinks and headed inside 5 of the wait staff were sitting behind the bar playing on their phones ( no wondering we hadn't seen her in a while). I will say the cherry coke was pretty good, but by the time we finally got our food my welfare patty was cold and chewy. Even our waitress when we did see her wasn't happy about working there.

Ordered a  $10 classic burger and what they bring to my table is completely dried out, thin as a piece of cardboard and completely tasteless!  Greatly disappointed! It's not often that we come here, but in the past. The burgers were thick and juicy.  The manager doesn't even bother to come to the table, "I'm cooking and can't take the time"...blah, blah, blah! Waitress brings me another burger, same kind of patty that looks like its out of a box from Sam's Club and says the manager cooked this himself. I sent it right back and said take it off the ticket .

Came here to have a burger and fries. Got the burger with the fried egg on top and it was good, not as good as mine .... but it was good. Cooked just the way we ordered it and I they split it just liked we asked. Appetizer was the pretzel bites, yum! Our beers were cold and the waitress was very attentive!!! What more could you want from a burger joint.... BUT of course I have to complain, the tables were so messy and they stayed that way the entire hour that we were there, and by tables I mean vacant tables all around us where people were sitting prior and the busboy never came to bus them until we were actually leaving so I must say they need to step that up

The smoke house burger was great. I didn't like the stacked onion rings. They where cold and the batter was thick. The mac and cheese was tasteless.  My server was polite but had to many tables at once. I froze trying to eat everyone was complaining about the room temperature.

After fighting our way through the Black Friday crowds, we had worked up quite an appetite.  My family and I decided a burger was definitely in the cards. And with this Red Robin location in the same parking lot as the mall, we wouldn't have to move the car through the killer traffic before eating. SOLD.  I went with my RR staple, the Bonzai Burger with bottomless fries and a strawberry freckled lemonade. The burger itself was totally fine, but the fries, which they're known for, were absolutely awful. They tasted like they had been sitting under a heat lamp for hours. I'm pretty sure I got the last remnants of the batch because on the way out of the restaurant, I saw some decent looking fries on other tables.  My wife ordered the chicken caesar salad and chicken-tortilla soup. The salad was pretty good she said, but the soup was terrible. It had also been obviously sitting out for a while, so the tortillas were completely soggy when it arrived at the table and there was hardly any chicken in it.  Service was pretty good, and the food came pretty quickly (which was surprising since it all tasted like it sat for a long time...).  I'll probably never be in North Carolina again, but I would definitely skip coming to this Red Robin if I was.
That was The most terrible service I've had. Paid for my beer and left. Never received my food. Waited over an hour. Won't go back.
My favorite restaurant . Try the rib tips with fries and top it off with a strawberry lemonade .

I have to tell you, I never take the time to come on here and leave reviews. I don't think I've been this disappointed in quite a while. The waitress that handles the bar and the to go orders her attitude could always be better. There are times I feel like I'm bothering her. Order chicken tortilla soup to go, received no tortilla strips or cheese. Both of which I asked for. This is the third time the order has been messed up and I'm just not sure their burgers are good enough to keep me coming back. When you spend that kind of money at an establishment, a family of four easily can reach over $50. You expect your tortilla strips.

I went to visit my Godchildren and this was by far the worst experience at a Red Robin. To start, the floors were disgusting and sticky - not to mention the bathrooms were dirty. When the server came, I asked for the gluten-free menu and she says "everything here is gluten free." Clearly she doesn't know what her own restaurant offers. The waitress took forever in getting our drinks and I ended up not eating my burger and fries because she didn't specify the allergy. Every other Red Robin I have been to, the manager brings out the GF food to confirm that it was properly made. Unfortunately, there's always a bad representation of a great chain.

I was not impressed. If I know anything I know a good burger when I eat one. What I had here was a mediocre burger. It did not taste like a freshly made burger. For the price they charge they should be ashamed of what they serve. They offer bottomless fries. After i received my first serving of fries, I didnt want more. They were far from fresh, tasted bland, lacked any flavor. They were barely warm. And some were even hard. Sure the decor was nice. Our waitress was very attentive but with the new gadget Robin on each table she was only needed to take our entree order and drink refills. For what we paid for our burgers and the taste any quality of our food, it just isn't worth going back. Hell they even charged a $2.00 entertainment fee! Wtf was that for? If you want a fresher, tastier and better quality burger. There are better choices in Fayetteville. Not to mention less expensive. Message me and I'll tell you where

My wife and I have tried this place 3 times. Once out of those 3 times was exceptional. First time was horrible and the last time was in my opinion ordinary. I guess some places are just meant to be a bar. I can honestly say though, the wait staff is always friendly and courteous.

I have enjoyed Red Robin...until we ate here. The food tonight was just not good. The taste was off and my sangria was watered down. The kids didn't finish their food either - and they normally love it. The fried shrimp had way too much breading and the fries were nasty. The whole meal left a bad taste in my mouth. Plus they charged a $1.99 entertainment fee for using the tablet that sits on the table for games without warning.  So disappointed.
Decent  burgers. Definitely beats Burger King.....service is some what slow. But good nonetheless.

2 hours for zucchini fries salads. New menu is disgusting. Salads keep changing and are NOT healthy. So much dressing they're like soup. Rotten avocados and cold rubbery overcooked chicken. Service was so ridiculous and inattentive. Dirty utensils. Never refilled drinks. Manager seemed so stressed and like he'd frankly given up on the restaurant. Will never return to this location.

Not a fan. Ordered burger medium, it was served to me well. Fries were not hot. They are bottomless so I could've ordered more but they should be hot the first time and I didn't want my burger to cool while I waited. The burger I ordered was flame grilled, and for some reason that made it a few bucks more expensive but all I could really taste throughout the meal was the char so I'd probably order the normal style if I go back again. Service was friendly...Would have let my server or the manager know about the over cooked burger if I was asked specifically how the food is rather than just if I'm doing ok or need anything. My experience was mediocre which will probably not keep me coming back. I left wishing I had spent my $20 elsewhere.

OMG the waitress we had today creeped is out. All she wanted to do was talk and join our conversations. It was like she was really desperate for a good tip. The burger was way over done and the toppings were not good. Also the restrooms have something left to be desired. The men's room has multiple racial and sexual slurs etched into the stall walls and it appears the owner just crosses them out badly every so often. I had posted a picture but Yelp removed it do it violating their policies, but the slurs are still there. Not the best Red Robin I've been to.
Service is too slow. Very disappointing. First time at a red Robin and will never come again.

Tried Red Robin for the first time on 4/23/16. The ladies room had overflowing paper towel piling up a foot around the waste basket and stalls missing toilet paper. We ordered 2 burgers cooked medium well. After an hour they came out and one was rare and the fries were cold. The waitress was rude, possibly because the table behind us also had a messed up order. A half hour later a replacement burger arrived. We paid the entire bill with no compensation.

So I don't eat at a lot of chain restaurants, but in Fayetteville you don't have much choice.  The reviews here were pretty bad so we had low expectations, but were pleasantly surprised.  Honestly the service was fast, food tasty, and the prices are fair.  My one tip: get the onion rings!  The perfect mix of crispy breading and warm onion inside.  Soooo good!  The burgers were fine, you only get two options, a little pink in the middle or no pink at all.  Oh well, still tastes good
Great place to go with the family. Service is hit or miss (asking you what you need) some days, but it's easy to ask for what you want. Most of the time I love this place.

This place has me confused. Service is manic and the food is unpredictable. One time you go food is great, service horrible, or service rocks and food makes you wish you were dead 30 minutes after you eat it.  I have had everything from mooing burgers to a burnt black patty melt. Sometimes you get offered more fries, sometimes you don't.  I save this place for days when I am not starving because you never know. Back after 2 years some things just don't change . Tip= order the exact opposite of what you want, and maybe you will get lucky and actually have one thing right.

We showed up yesterday (Saturday) around 1130 and it wasn't packed. Around 1200, it got really busy. The waitress we had was new but she was pretty good, a bit pushy but still good. The food was average but greasy. How are pretzel bites greasy? I thought it was butter but no, it wasn't. The soup and wrap was a deal. Their clam chowder actually had clams in each spoonful! Atmosphere was relaxed but with two adults ordering two appetizers and two meals with drinks came to $65. A bit pricey for lunch for ok food.

My husband and I visited this location at approximately 6 p.m. On a Monday evening. The lights were out on the outside of the building. We did not know if they were open. We saw some cars in the parking lot and also people dining inside. When we entered the building we asked if they were open. They joked and laughed about the lights being out. We were seated almost immediately. At the table of our choice. Our server was training tonight so he was accompanied by another server. Our appetizer came quickly! Then our meal came. One burger was completely wrong. It took nearly 30 minutes to get it corrected. That's ever put it in the system wrong so the wrong burger came. When the correct order was delivered, I had already finished eating my meal. At the server blamed it on my husband for ordering the wrong burger....seriously!?!?!? Additionally my fries came cold with my burger. We might visit again. But will warn friends if they decide to come here. What happened to the customer is always right?!?!
Love this place. Lettuce wrapped avocado burger with sweet potatoe fries and raspberry tea!!!

Like the new look! Disappointed they don't have the Southwest Chicken salad and they have spring mix in their other salads YUK!! I HATE WEED SALAD!!!  So I got the red robbin 6.99 burger with fresh jalapeños and it was really good!

Service was great! Thanks Ashley B! The burger meat and toppings were delicious, but the bun couldn't hold it together. Come on Red Robin! Step up your bun game! All jokes aside, overall it was good, but if you want a great review work on the bun situation.

We were craving a burger and weren't sure where to go in Fayetteville, so we opted for Red Robin. It was about 2:15 pm. Very friendly upon our arrival. We were seated at a small table when it quickly became apparent that this place isn't very well kept - crumbs everywhere, including on tables & seats; looked like it hadn't been swept or vacuumed in a couple of days. It was a beautiful day out, but it was definitely too cold in the restaurant. So we asked if we could sit outside and were told to go ahead out there. The waitress told us she would be right out. She never came out. Another waitress came over and asked if we'd been helped and took our order.  The outdoor section was also unkempt. One table not cleared after people had eaten.  Waitress was very friendly, took our order and came back with water. Food came quickly: I had the Red Robin burger and hubby had the Smoke & Fire burger. Both burgers were good, although hubby asked for his pink in middle and it was cooked all the way through. I had sweet potato fries and he had steak fries. Both came out cold, although mine were fairly crispy. Definitely won't be eating here again unless they clean this place up and serve their food warmer. Have to find a good burger joint in Fayetteville!

Over an hour for food and still nothing. Waited 10 minutes to be seated. Ordered right when we sat down got our milk shake and than nothing. The waitress hasn't even come over to check on us or refill drinks.

Excellent service by Angela and the kitchen made my husband a special request wrap. Thank you to both. As always the food was great. Ordered sweet peach tea and it was good. Got to eat here every time I'm in town.

Our family enjoyed carry out from Red Robin Fayetteville, NC tonight. A great experience. We ordered by phone, received a follow up call to confirm our order and picked up the order at the bar. The employee assisting was very courteous and attentive to our customer experience.  My wife picked our order up and raved about the lady at the bar who assisted with our order. The food was good and prepared to our specifications. It ia always great to feel appreciated and valued as a customer. We will be back! Four stars for attention to service and in market comparison to peers offering like menu.

Noise, no napkins , appetizer came ate no napkins, corner round table party of 7 older heavy set can't sit in round booth belly wedged for entire meal. Food average not large servings price is high to moderate.meal taste good, lots of kids and more kids.

For starters, I work at a local chain restaurant around the corner so I know how the business can go on behind the scences so I am not a typical "entitled" patron.  Ok, I hadn't been to this location in years and couldn't quite remember why not. My fiance kept bugging me about eating here so when we were in Raleigh the other day we dined in for lunch and both LOVED the food. We decided to go to this location in Fayetteville yesterday and I can now remember why I wasn't impressed initially.  Our servers name was Lisa? and she greeted us within a reasonable time. My fiance and I ordered the chilli cheese fries (which were actually good) and then the same exact thing I had ordered at the last location..the insaine romaine salad. It is two very large wedges of romaine heads grilled and drizzled with Caesar dressing and parmesan as well as a grilled chicken breast.  So here's the real review. As she was carrying the plates out I was just hoping that it wasn't our food. From afar it looked unappealing. She sets the food in front of us and it looks as though the cook got a little negligent with our lettuce on the grill, it was very scorched. Not only that but the lettuce looked as though it needed to be thrown out a week ago, it had so much slimy mushy parts. The chicken breast was so dry. I tried a few bites and was just over it as well as my fiance. Well there was no way to tell that to the server because she didn't come back to our table for quite some time. the same with the other location as well. (Maybe I'm a little biased by my restaurants "3 minute bite check" ) so we just ate it as to not be a "bother" or difficult. Nor did we want to wait any longer for someone to walk by. when she did come back I was a good way through the salad, but that's not why she returned. She asked if we were paying card or cash and if we were familiar with the tablet to pay on. I said yes and her response was something like "okay! No rush I just wanted to make sure I didn't need to come back over here for anything" ummmmm what???? Needless to say our drinks NEVER got refilled. And no she never did return...at all. These tablets are allowing the sever to become complacent and thats the experience from BOTH restaurants. I'm typically a very generous tipper as I know the struggle, even when they are crappy and I am teaching my fiance this concept. I literally give him a lecture every time. I didn't even bother asking if he tipped or how much as I was so disappointed that I could've cared less. We at least paid for the crappy food that's the most we owed them. I will never eat here again.
Had to ask for refill, silverware,  napkin burger was dry, fries got cold waiting for mayo. just a bad experience. Waitress seemed aloof.....visits prior were great.
Friendly staff and excellent food. Love their endless fries

Arrived 3:00 pm 8-29-15. Hostess & Server were friendly & greeted promptly. Table was clean, but not seats, salt shakers or menus (quite icky). Burgers tasted like they are precooked over the flame grill, then just barely heated up to serve. 1 was ordered well done, and came out quite pink. Neither burger was hot (hence my theory of precooking and re-heating). The buns disintegrated before we were 1/2 done - I ended up using a knife & fork for almost 1/2 my burger. The fries were awesome, but it did take quite a while for the 'refills' to arrive. While the option of ordering via tablet looked interesting, I think that what it does most is to decrease the amount of attention servers pay to their tables. I'm not saying that is what happened this day, because our server did drop by a couple times, but I do see a potential for it.

Never is there a time that this place isn't busy as heck. The selection of burgers rival any other joint and the flavor surpases them all. Of course you must fight the crowd but it's definitely worth it if you are in the mood for MOOOO! =D
Food is really good and the menu has a decent selection for everyone. The staff is friendly and service was a bit slow considering the place was almost empty. Otherwise YUMMMMM! (A tad bit pricey)

I gave this place 2 stars because: table dirty ,  burgers ok but abit overprice,  staff is friendly but overworked , it is a place very popular with families, and some kids around here have excellet sets  of lungs. I would like to visit this place later at night without families to figure out this place better.
Went to eat with my family, it was a nice atmosphere but I didn't think there burgers were all that people make them out to be and not worth the price. I most likely won't be going back.

We were in the mood for big bacon cheeseburgers and steak fries and thats exactly what we got!  Loved it.   I will say that burger was just a smidge over-cooked.  I asked for it medium, now there was no pink in the middle at all, but it wasn't quite medium well either.  So I dunno if there's even an in between from medium to medium-well, but that's what it was.  Which wasn't bad at all, just an observation.  I'd go so far to say the chef did cook the burger properly, it probably just continued cooking on it's own from the time it was done to delivery to the table.   But I won't let that lowball my review.  If you want a good cheeseburger and fries..look no further!  The waitress was very personable and friendly as well.

Have returned to Red Robin several times.   Discovered they have a wedge salad as an appetizer....   good sized portion of iceberg lettuce, blue cheese dressing, crumbles of blue cheese, fried onion straws (ask for fresh ones), bacon and I think it had chopped tomatoes too.   VERY REASONABLE.   Get it instead of a meal for a healthier alternative.

Tried to call ahead tonight but was told they do not offer call ahead seating but could accommodate large parties if I called 15-20 min ahead. I advised 'Antwan' that's what I was doing and gave him my name and he said he "duly note that." Of course when we got there our name was nowhere to be found. Luckily the wait wasn't too long. The food was good and besides that one hiccup we had a nice dinner.
This Red Robin Location is awesome. Our experience has always been good but Monday was exceptional.
french onion soup is the bomb !!! fries are the best !!! lemonades are amazing !!! royal red robin burger is the best burger !!! i just love red robin !!!

went on a Friday evening. reasonable wait time. could not order bottomless fries as a part of my appetizer, not a big deal, but as a part of free-refills, I like to start early and had already had ordered an appetizer. drinks took forever, and my appetizer took longer. however, I had plenty of time to enjoy it because the food took forever. I had asked for a refill which never came. then the waitress was reminded of mine and my son's thirst. then the food came out. ordered medium for my patty and it was well done. fries cold, bread dry and falling apart, cheese melted and resolidified. wasn't super surprised as I could see someone onion tower sitting in the kitchen window for about 10 minutes. Plus, the waitress set their entertainment system game machine next to my 3 year old, which he unlocked quickly and we were billed 1.99. fortunately, she took the cost off, but she said it happens all the time. and I ended up getting my last drink to go, because she had forgot again. the food had potential, but nothing really went well.
As a vegan this is one of the few places in town I can eat at. They have a vegan burger that you can substitute for meat AND they have bottomless fries!

Food was excellent, very yummy and good quality, but even before Darcie the waitress at the Fayetteville restaurant take our order she told us to sign up for a free milkshake, so we did, after a few trys my friend phone dont let her do it but I did just right and leave my phone number and all the information they ask just to get my free milkshake, anyway the food were late and the check got back to me (she don't forget to charge me) but i never see or taste the precious milkshake. ...! What a bummer, I took my time for NOTHING,  is a shame because I really like the place and the food but I don't think I will back here, anyway is so many other places to eat as good as here and respect the customer and don't lie. Oh well

Serivce here is alway on top of their game.  Food is really good and love the bottom-less fries, especially for my teen.  The price is a little high for burgers so we don't go as often as we would like.  Food is always hot and fresh when it gets to the tables.  they did just revamp their menu and it's a little confusing to read unlike their older 2 page menu.  Anyway do recommend Red Robin!
Big burgers and good service. The food was piping hot and fresh. i wouldnt say this was the best burger joint ever but its pretty good. my server was friendly and the food came quickly.

10/30/14... we decided to get some gourmet burgers that nite, worst decision ever the waitress/bartender got our drinks then we waited 30 min after that we asked her about our food when finally arrived ....everythingggg was cold, disgusting...i really paid my check because we r educated ppl but i guess they lost 4 customers.. ..never again!! thank u for the impression.

One of my favorite places to get food. Bottomless cajun fries and the burgers are decent. Drinks and celebrating are definitely a plus. Pre game here with some food and drinks and head out to your next destination, to continue your boozing!

I love this place! I always have great service and get burgers. I can never finish my burger. I do wish that they would bring back kettle chips and the pub burger those were my favorite. I hate that change the menu but what  can I do I don't own this place lol. Anyways back to the point we have a great time great rootbeer floats and the bar staff are quick

For Fayetteville, this is a good place to get good food and good service. They put much more emphasis on good service than most places here do. They always have fun new burgers, good drinks, and it is a great place to go with a group. I just learned they have Happy Hour from 3-6 pm and 8pm-close on Monday- Friday. This includes discounted well drinks and $3-$5 appetizers. We got sweet potato fries during Happy Hour and they were delicious!

For what it is, it's great, the only place in Fayetteville (aside from hamburger heaven) to get a good burger that isn't fast food. It is a chain so if you had one you've had them all, good quality burgers with a large assortment of them. The drinks are good and the staff is always nice. I like that I can take my son there and not feed him complete crap and I can give him a better side than fries as they have a large assortment of sides for kids including different fruits and healthy options, which really matters to me.
Really good burgers! Better than Chili's. This is a great family restaurant and the price is good for what you get. I like the burning love burger or the black and blue burger.

For a place that labels itself "gourmet" burgers, I was disappointed. Fries were quite good. Burgers were OK, but I've had a lot better. Onion rings were well done. Another franchise restaurant with just passable food.
